recipes.creditText: Can't Stay out of the Kitchen
recipes.sourceName: Can't Stay out of the Kitchen

extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 stick Land O' Lakes butter, softened

extendedIngredients.name: pecans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Diamond chopped pecans or walnuts

extendedIngredients.name: unbleached flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ½ cups Gold-Medal UNBLEACHED all-purpose flour (bleached flour toughens baked goods)

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla pudding mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 3-oz. box French Vanilla pudding & pie filling mix

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Pudding Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies on the menu? Try pairing with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Mix butter, pudding, milk and powdered sugar with an electric mixer to combine.Add eggs and vanilla and mix again.Stir in flour, graham cracker crumbs, coconut, pecans and chocolate chips.Mix with a wooden spoon to combine well.Roll dough into balls or scoop with an ice cream dip.Place on cookie sheets that have been greased or sprayed with cooking spray.Bake at 350° for about 4 minutes.Press down lightly with a fork in criss-cross pattern.Return cookies to oven and bake an additional 4 minutes or until done.Rotate pans on racks half way through baking.

steps.step: Mix butter, pudding, milk and powdered sugar with an electric mixer to combine.
Add eggs and vanilla and mix again.Stir in flour, graham cracker crumbs, coconut, pecans and chocolate chips.
Mix with a wooden spoon to combine well.
Roll dough into balls or scoop with an ice cream dip.
Place on cookie sheets that have been greased or sprayed with cooking spray.

Bake at 350° for about 4 minutes.Press down lightly with a fork in criss-cross pattern.Return cookies to oven and bake an additional 4 minutes or until done.Rotate pans on racks half way through baking.
